noun.description: A process of voting, in writing and typically in secret.
examples: the commissioners were elected by ballot

verb.description: (of an organization) elicit a secret vote from (members) on a particular issue.
examples: the union is preparing to ballot its members on the same issue

origin: Mid 16th century (originally denoting a small colored ball placed in a container to register a vote): from Italian ballotta, diminutive of balla (see ball).
